page.title: 19Superstitions in Maltby
page.content: Many people are,it seems,quite superstitious. Also there are one or two local legends. One of these legends is about the White Lady of the Comprehensive School. It is said that there once was a girl walking down the school clock tower steps when she tripped and fell to her death. It is now said that when the clock strikes midnight, the White Lady walks the corridors of the school.There are many superstitions,which include the more common ones about the bad luck which may be incurred by putting new shoes on the table,or opening umbrellas in the house. It is said to be unlucky to cross people on the stairs but it is considered lucky to have a peacock's feather. However,if crows are perched on a house,it is a sign of imminent death! Many people in Maltby know many superstitions,and always keep to them.
